intro: Doronicum candolleanum, commonly known as the alpine goldcup, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Doronicum candolleanum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
